Active Reward Vault allows 1 lock only.

timeToMigrateSubtitle2: After that, you will not be able to migrate your DOUGH anymore.

migrateOneLockSubtitle: Single veDOUGH position to ${token} (Require multiple transactions)
smartContractAddressNotAllowed: Smart contract wallets like Argent or Gnosis Safe are not allowed.
withoutBoost: Without boosting, the vesting end date will be the longest among your locks.
ARVConversionBanner: Conversion 100 DOUGH = 1 AUXO, see the next step for details
PRVConversionBanner: Conversion 100 DOUGH = 1 AUXO, see the next step for details
DOUGHtoAUXO: DOUGH will be converted to AUXO at 100:1 rate (ex. ‚Äú‚Äù)
AUXOtoArvPrv: You choose whether to receive ARV or PRV
faq1Answer:
We're migrating locked DOUGH to locked AUXO. You will be able to choose to lock AUXO as ARV or PRV. Only veDOUGH holders will be able to migrate their DOUGH locks to ARV or PRV.

‚ö†Ô∏è If you're looking for options for DOUGH, or eDOUGH please go to https://piedaoorg.on.fleek.co/#/buyback
faq2: What are the differences between veDOUGH and ARV staking?
faq2Answer:
The main difference is that, with veDOUGH, users can have multiple locks in the same wallet.

  • veDOUGH locks are created when somebody stakes DOUGH for veDOUGH, and expire at a certain point in time. Staking multiple times creates multiple locks, with separate expiry dates.
  • ARV has a single-lock mechanism. All ARV locked by the user will expire at the same time. Additional locked AUXO can be added, and unless specified, this will expire at the same time as existing ARV.
faq3: What shall I choose: ARV or PRV?
faq3Answer:
• Choose ARV if you are willing to commit to active governance while receiving the highest possible returns (rewards).
  • Choose PRV if you are willing to be passive on governance by holding a governance free and transferable asset.
ARV is a non-transferable asset that will allow you to get monthly rewards for governing the DAO. It receives more rewards, can be redeemed for AUXO after the lock expiration, and has the option to exit to its staking derivative (PRV) by paying a premium.PRV is staking derivative build on top of ARV. It is a transferable asset that will allow you to get monthly rewards without the need to participate in governance. Holding a staking derivative and being governance-agnostic has a price: you get fewer rewards compared to ARV, and won‚Äôt be able to claim AUXO as the lock does not expire.
faq4Answer:
Option 1: Migrate all your DOUGH locks (aggregate) to one single lock to either ARV or PRV.Option 2: Migrate your DOUGH locks to either ARV or PRV one by one to individual addresses.Option 3: Combination of the above (single lock/s to ARV and aggregate the remaining to PRV, or vice versa)

Notes:(a) You can choose to boost your lock to MAX (36 months) only when aggregating ARV locks ‚Äî which will also reset your lock start date and gives you the best AUXO:ARV ratio.(b) Aggregation can only be done in the wallet that holds the DOUGH locks ‚Äî this is true for ARV and PRV.(c) Single locking for ARV will be possible only on wallets with no DOUGH or AUXO locks.(d) Single locks are migrated in an order determined by the contract: longest locks first.(e) The same wallet can hold ARV and PRV.
faq5: What happens if I aggregate all locks?
faq5Answer:
All your DOUGH locks will be merged into one lock. For ARV, the new lock duration will be determined by the remaining time to expiration of your longest DOUGH lock (amount of months until its expiration date) ‚Äî impacting the amount of ARV received. The end date will be derived from adding the new lock‚Äôs duration to the date you migrated.

In case you decide to boost your lock, you will be locking for 36 months and updating the start date to the transaction date. The amount of ARV will be the highest in regard to their staking curve.

Examples:(a) You choose to migrate to ARV aggregating your locks without boosting. Let‚Äôs consider your longest lock to have 10 months left for expiration. Your new lock in this case will equal to locking AUXO in a new single lock for 10 months and the amount of ARV received would be subject to the staking curve for a 10 months commitment.(b) You choose to migrate to ARV aggregating your locks and boosting. Let‚Äôs consider your longest lock to have 10 months left for expiration. Your new lock in this case will result in locking AUXO in a new single lock for 36 months with a reset in the start date and the amount of ARV received would be equal to locking AUXO for 36 months.(c) You choose to migrate to PRV aggregating your locks. The DOUGH on your locks will be migrated to AUXO(100:1 ratio), and you will receive an amount of PRV subject to the AUXO:PRV ratio (TBD).
faq6: What happens if I migrate my locks individually?
faq6Answer:
Migrating locks individually will allow you to move each lock to a new wallet (1 lock, 1 wallet) ‚Äî the destination wallets should not hold any locks. You can choose to migrate 1 lock to your DOUGH lock holding address, or individual locks to different addresses.

Note: Only 1 ARV lock per address is allowed. If your wallet holds multiple locks and you migrate only one to ARV on it you will not be able to aggregate the rest to ARV anymore on it ‚Äî the remaining locks will either need to be migrated to other wallets, migrated to PRV or remain as veDOUGH.
faq7: What are the implications of picking the current vs new wallet?
faq7Answer:
• Aggregating ARV ‚Üí Allowed only in the same wallet ‚Äî Not possible if it holds a ARV lock, but possible if it holds an PRV lock.
  • Single ARV locks ‚Üí Allowed in the same or a new wallet ‚Äî Can co-exist with an PRV lock in either. Not possible to aggregate ARV at a later stage in the same wallet if a single lock is created.
  • Aggregating PRV ‚Üí Allowed only in the same wallet ‚Äî Possible if it holds other PRV or even a ARV lock.
  • Single PRV lock ‚Üí Allowed in the same or a new wallet ‚Äî Can co-exist with other PRV locks in either and aggregate in the same wallet.
faq8: My locks expire next month, why can I only stake them for 6 months?
faq8Answer: The duration of non-boosted locks migrated to ARV are determined by the remaining time to expiration of your longest vDOUGH lock (amount of months until its expiration date). Yet, if the amount of months are lower than the minimum lock time (6 months), then your new lock will be automatically set to the minimum.
faq9: I made a mistake and chose the incorrect option, can I revert?
faq9Answer: You can't, so don‚Äôt rush. You can always reach out on Discord for assistance.
faq10: Why is my veDOUGH balance greater than the resulting ARV?
faq10Answer:
The migration is about moving your locked DOUGH to AUXO, and then staking AUXO for either ARV or PRV. During that process, there‚Äôre three ratios that apply:

  • DOUGH:AUXO ratio:The DOUGH to AUXO conversion is set at 100:1. This has been set in order to define the AUXO supply and to factor in the DOUGH supply after completing the burning of the Treasury-owned DOUGH.
  • AUXO:ARV ratio:The number of ARV obtained by staking AUXO is determined by two elements: the locked amount and the time commitment (6 to 36 months), following the curve: y=x/k*log(x) ‚Äî just as veDOUGH did.
  • AUXO:PRV ratio:The number of PRV obtained by staking AUXO is determined by this ratio which is subject to a minting fee. This minting fee has not yet been defined, and for testing purposes has been set to zero.
faq11: I have questions...a lot. Where can I go?
faq11Answer: Join us at Discord and it will be taken care of
faq12: What happens if I don't migrate on time?
faq12Answer:
Your remaining locked DOUGH will be unlocked, and you will be able to claim it. There won't be future migrations.

‚ö†Ô∏è If you don't migrate by April 2023 (to be ratified) you won't be able to migrate at all!
faq13: What will happen to any DOUGH after the migration?
faq13Answer: DOUGH will always be with us ‚Äî yet it won‚Äôt serve any purpose in the Auxo DAO. DOUGH won‚Äôt be migrated, and its utility, issuance, burning, and liquidity provision will be halted by the time the migration starts. Holders will be able to trade it as long as there‚Äôs a secondary market for it. Any secondary market will neither be promoted nor supported by the DAO.
faq14: I‚Äôm a veDOUGH holder, and I want out. What can I do?
faq14Answer: After the migration DOUGH will be unlocked and available for claiming.
faq15Answer: Every month the DAO Treasury will distribute rewards to ARV and PRV stakers that come from the Treasury Farming operations. Both PRV and ARV holders will receive rewards, but the ARV rewards distributed per token will be higher than the PRV rewards per token: reflecting the premium placed on having a liquid token, and not having a need to govern the DAO. In other words, ARV holders get 60% of the profit from the Treasury-farmed assets, while PRV holders will get proportionally less, as if 40% was distributed instead.
faq16Answer: ARV token holders will benefit from direct on-chain governance capabilities and their share will enable them to vote and govern the DAO. For ARV holders voting is an action required to be eligible for the monthly rewards distribution. On the other hand, PRV holders do not benefit from these governance capabilities, as they delegate the work to the ARV holders as part of the trade-off for being liquid. Instead of voting, PRV holders require to stake their token in order to be eligible for the monthly rewards distribution.
faq17Answer: ARV is a non-transferable token, meaning that it will stay in the wallet chosen until the lock is over and can be unlocked and redeemed for AUXO. In comparison, PRV is a transferable token that can be transferred freely, as it‚Äôs a liquid staking derivative of ARV.
faq18Answer: AUXO holders choosing to stake to ARV will be able to select a lock period between 6 and 36 months, and once locked can opt-in to boost their position ‚Äî once the lock is over ARV holders can redeem their tokens and get back their AUXO.ARV holders choosing to migrate to PRV will be locking AUXO perpetuity, meaning that they won‚Äôt be able to redeem PRV for AUXO at any given point in the future.
faq19Answer: AUXO introduces a way for ARV holders to create recurring liquidity events, also known as bonding, in order to increase treasury principal by minting tokens. Bonding to ARV always happens at the exact NAV price, while bonding to PRV is subject to premium (TBD) ‚Äî in consequence bonding to PRV increases the NAV price.
faq20Answer: There are no fees associated with minting ARV tokens. On the contrary, a mint fee (20%) may be applied when PRV is minted.
faq21Answer: ARV can only be exited at lock expiration. PRV can‚Äôt be exited but traded. At any given point in time, ARV can be locked in perpetuity by minting PRV (minting fee applies), and PRV then traded to exit the position.
